fields.Description/Abstract:
Can gaming be a college career? What does it take to make collegiate eSports successful or get a University program off the ground? Can eSports be bigger than college football? This panel will discuss buy-in, recruitment, titles, sponsorships, promotion, streaming, careers through eSports, and much more. The panel will bring together experts from competitive university programs, Blizzard, Twitch, and regulatory agencies (TESPA & NACe) to discuss what makes a Varsity eSports program successful.

PANELISTS
Dr. Chris Haskell [Clinical Professor, Boise State Univ], Kevin Hoang [Student Program Coordinator, Twitch], Michael Brooks [Director, National Association of Collegiate eSports], Adam Rosen [TESPA, Blizzard/TESPA], Mark Deppe [Director of Esports, UC Irvine], AJ Dimick [Director of Esports, University of Utah]
